23600.title: Before the Justicar stronghold
23600.description:
The undergrowth on either side of the path to the north thins as it
approaches the glass-domed structure to the south. The building's high
walls of white marble thrust forth from the ground beneath, their well-
polished surface gleaming much like the iridescent path to the north.
Supported by thick pillars of granite at each corner of the building,
the wall frames a tall, pointed arch that allows passage to the south.
Within the arch hang thick wooden doors, inlaid with decorative runes of
shining platinum and softly glowing mithril. The arched gate appears open
but entrance into the structure may not be a good idea without the
permission of the Stronghold.

extras.description:
Occasional foot traffic keeps the short grass bordering the trail
stunted. Further from the path, however, that sparse vegetation
quickly grows into a formidable wall of slender, tightly packed trees
and clinging evergreen undergrowth. Some light does make it through,
but it would be difficult to progress very far into the foliage.

The gleaming runes somehow make their meaning known to you:
"ORDER IS ESSENTIAL TO SOCIETY"

Massive slabs of white, polished marble have been planted firmly into
the ground to serve as the walls of this building. The entryway facing
north is fairly narrow, but the thinner greenery near the walls
reveals a greater width to the structure further south.

Circular shafts of rough granite at least eight feet around stand at
each corner of the front wall of the building. Broad bases curve up
into smooth columns, and the capital of each pillar has been carefully
shaped to resemble an open scroll. Deep runes have been carved in
each. The east pillar reads "From chaos, Order"; the west declares
"From anarchy, Society".

The stones forming the pointed arch of the doorway have been carefully
carved and fitted into a seamless curve. More remarkable, however, is
the color of the marble used. The stones near the bottom are a jet
black marble, in sharp contrast to the surrounding white walls. As the
arch rises from the ground, the color brightens from black to dark
grey, to light grey, and finally to white near the top. The keystone,
perhaps twenty feet high, is composed of softly glowing elysium. The
oaken doors hanging within the arch are weatherbeaten but sturdy, and
the decorative runes within still shine brightly.

23601.title: Entrance to the Justicar stronghold
23601.description:
Many of the rooms have been transported brick by brick from the
previous Stronghold building but some changes have been made as well.
Widely spaced walls of white marble border a spacious hallway leading
north and south. An arched ceiling overhead is supported by many slender,
intricately carved pillars, and it echoes the sound of running water
coming from the south. The floor is made of the same grey stone that
composes the pillars, and is mostly unremarkable, though it is
interrupted just inside the door by a huge and intricate mosaic. The jet-
black opal on one side seems to struggle against the pearl of purest
white on the other, but there is harmony in their balance as well. A
chamber opens southward and massive wooden doors are set in the thick
walls to the north, allowing exit from the Justicar fortress.

extras.description:
The exquisite mosaic dominates the entrance, a yin-yang crafted with
shards of darkest opal and hundreds of bright pearls. The inherent
message of Duality lends solemnity to the Stronghold's entranceway,
encouraging no footfall here to be taken lightly. The mosaic is here
in tribute to the lord Kaleb.

23602.title: Grand foyer
23602.description:
The stronghold opens into a massive central chamber, lit by natural
light streaming through a glass dome perhaps forty feet above. Your view
of the dome is slightly obstructed by a walkway the seems to connect
rooms at either end of the second floor of the stronghold. Benches of
stone line the curved walls of the chamber, offering places of rest to
tired lawmen. In the middle of the room is a magnificent fountain,
layered in rising concentric circles of marble and surrounded by lush,
flowering greenery. Atop a high pedestal at the fountain's crown stands a
large Scale of bright bronze, untarnished by the vapor that the splashing
water produces. A small room opens up to the west.

extras.description:
The plants here are exotic, not native to this part of Thera. Imported
from the grasslands far to the southwest, the flowers' survival is
ensured by the fountain's continual nourishment and the gentle
sunlight that sometimes filters down from the dome above.

A thick shaft of polished bronze serves as the center of this huge
scale. The shaft tapers off towards the top, where it meets a thin
crossbar. On each end of the crossbar, the balanced platforms are
supported by extremely thin, finely-wrought chains. The scale is
evidently placed here to honor the lord Malistien. Oddly enough, as
you look, the scale seems almost to tilt of its own accord...

23603.title: Apothecary
23603.description:
The western wall of this room is filled with long wooden shelves. They
are filled with hundreds of different concoctions and poultices contained
in jars of every shape, size and color. Despite the prolific number of
containers that fill the shelves, they are remarkably neat, with each jar
carefully labelled and facing forward for easy access. Each of the
mixtures looks meant to aid the healing arts in some way. A door leads
back out to the east into the massive foyer.

23604.title: Training grounds
23604.description:
This corner of the Justicar stronghold contains a small battleground,
an arena designed to allow the lawmen to practice and duel to hone
their skills. The marble floor stops suddenly, dropping down into a
pit perhaps thirty feet across and four deep. Decorative weapons hang
on the southern and eastern walls, though nicks along their blades
indicate that the weapons were not always purely ornamental. The
bottom of the pit has been filled with a coarse white sand, clumped
here and there with dried blood- the training that takes place here
must be serious indeed. A pile of limp-looking practice dummies rests
in the southeast corner, and bits of cloth that used to be practice
dummies lie partially buried under the sand. The stronghold continues
to a dim room northward, and west to a large stairwell.

23605.title: Commissary
23605.description:
This room is split north to south by a low wooden counter. The wood is
a light and well polished oak, but has been stained all over with
patches of a dark, crusty substance. The stone floor bears similar
stains- this whole area could use a thorough cleaning. Behind the
counter, all manner of boxes and crates have been haphazardly stacked.
Some open, some closed, many empty, they contain the bulk of the
Justicar provisions. A sign on the counter lists all the items
currently available to the lawmen.

extras.description:
*********************************
* Available to the Justicars:   *
*   standard issue rucksack     *
*   pigeon-feather quill        *
*   inkwell                     *
*   official stationery         *
*   Nar's Meat Surprise         *
*   Compendium                  *
*                               *
* Courtesy of Shorty's brewery: *
*   Ebony Stout                 *
*   Shorty's barley ale         *
*                               *
*********************************

23606.title: Justicar barracks
23606.description:
The walls of this low room are lined with rows of bunkbeds, packed
tightly together. The dirty stone floor bears a number of worn
pieces of clothing, casually tossed aside by owners in a hurry to meet
their next obligation as lawmen. The bunks themselves, however, are
tightly and uniformly made- sheets tucked firmly beneath the mattress,
pillows on top. Some of the beds have small chests next to them for
personal effects, but they contain nothing of note. The barracks
continue to the south.

extras.description:
Sweaty, worn and tattered, these old pieces of clothing are more
suited to be used as rags than worn.

23607.title: Base of the grand stairwell
23607.description:
A wide spiral staircase stands at the southern end of the stronghold's
first floor, leading upstairs to a quieter portion of the Justicar
fortress. The steps of broad marble are lined down the center with a
thick, rich carpeting of deep blue. The thousands footfalls these steps
bear are heavy with both weight and with responsibility. A wide tapestry
is hung along the inner wall of the stairwell, and a tall painting stands
opposite. A gleaming railing of brass follows the outside of the circular
stairwell as it ascends towards a bright room above. A wide, shallow pit
yawns open in the floor eastward while to the west, you can see massive
shelves of supplies. A grand courtyard opens up to the north while to the
south, you may exit into a wooded area.

extras.description:
The tapestry consists of multicolored silks stitched onto a background
of light blue wool. They depict an ancient priest with a flowing beard
of white, setting a bright feathered quill to a massive Book, as an
imposing owl stretches its wings overhead.

The work depicts a paladin in silver platemail, facing an indistinct
horde painted mostly in dark red and black. The paladin is thrusting a
balled fist toward heaven, and a massive hand is forming above the
encroaching enemies in response.

23608.title: Above the grand stairwell
23608.description:
This wide marble stairwell is capped by a dome of clear glass. Offices
flank you to the east and west while a suspended walkway traverses the
stronghold from south to north. The walkway passes directly underneath
the massive glass dome. In the center of the glass dome above, thousands
of shards of frosted glass have been mounted to form a four-pointed star
that glows gently in the sky's light. The staircase descends to the floor
below.

extras.description:
The pattern of lightly stained glass is lit from behind by the sky
above, but it glows with an inner light also, gently illuminating
the stairwell beneath even in the darkest hour of night.

23609.title: Council of the Justicars
23609.description:
A smooth floor of grey marble supports the massive oaken table that
dominates this room, its polished surface gleaming in the flickering
light of the torches mounted along the walls. A single chair stands at
the head of the long table, intended for the High Arbiter of the
Justicars to preside over the meetings that take place here. Most
striking in this room, however, are the two statues mounted on the
northern and southern walls. The two avian figures oversee the
deliberations with outstretched wings and gleaming eyes- one a bright
phoenix, the other a dark owl. A door offers exit to the west.

extras.description:
Mounted high on the northern wall, this magnificent Phoenix is crafted
from yellow gold and deep orange amber, with streaks of fire-red ruby
and bright elysium running throughout. The odd mix of materials is
combined with incredible skill- the bird is actually clothed in
individual, delicate feathers of these precious materials. The light
glancing off the statue gives the impression of a continual blaze. It
is unlikely that such a masterpiece is the work of purely mortal
hands. Piercing eyes of emerald stare down over a sharp beak, a
reminder that the high lord Riallus once blessed the Law with his
guidance.

Mysterious and imposing, the massive Owl on the south wall of the
chamber is fashioned of polished opal, dark green malachite and the
blackest of obsidian. Its finely wrought feathers are flecked with a
fair amount of silver as well, giving the impression of great age, but
without a hint of frailty. The curved beak and wicked talons are made
of pure gold, their brightness standing out in sharp contrast to the
statue's feathers. Lifelike eyes of glittering emerald oversee the
proceedings, ensuring that in Wervdon's name, decisions here are made
with wisdom.

23610.title: Shrine of Law
23610.description:
This small shrine is the most sacred room in the Justicar fortress.
The walls are built in a nearly perfect circle, and composed of
swirling black, grey and white marble. The low ceiling above is broken
by a skylight of multifaceted crystal that glows dimly no matter the
hour of the day. Beneath the skylight, lit by a thousand small shafts
of light from above, is an immense pillar. The pillar thrusts up from
the center of a gaping hole in the earth, too deep to make out the
bottom, too deep to fathom. A short outcropping of stone bridges the
chasm, allowing the monstrous pillar to be approached. Behind the
pillar on the northern wall, a heavy banner proudly displays the Seal
of the Justicars. A break in the eastern wall permits exit.

extras.description:
The thick cloth tapestry has been dyed a blue so dark it is almost black,
and the Seal is stitched in thread of pure white and shimmering gold- a
huge owl, wings spread in flight, its cruel-looking talons clenching both
a quill and a sword.

23611.title: Justicar barracks
23611.description:
The walls of this low room are lined with rows of bunkbeds, packed
tightly together. The dirty stone floor bears a number of worn
pieces of clothing, casually tossed aside by owners in a hurry to meet
their next obligation as lawmen. The bunks themselves, however, are
tightly and uniformly made- sheets tucked firmly beneath the mattress,
pillows on top. Some of the beds have small chests next to them for
personal effects, but they contain nothing of note. A wide, shallow
pit interrupts the floor southward, and the barracks continue to the
north.

23612.title: High Arbiter's Office
23612.description:
This office is sparsely decorated. A massive desk sits facing the door
while an uncomfortable wooden chair sits behind it. A small potted plant
sits by a large window on the western wall through which you can see lush
forest as far as the eye can see. Bookshelves line both the northern and
southern walls of the room and are filled with numerous tomes about the
law and various other subjects. A deep-blue colored rug covers part of
the marble floor with the Seal of Justice at its center. You may exit
back to the stairwell to the east.

23613.title: Chief Magistrate's Office
23613.description:
This office is sparsely decorated. A massive desk sits facing the door
while sturdy looking wooden chair sits behind it. A small potted plant
sits by a large window on the eastern wall through which you can see the
surrounding lands. To the east you can make out the small village of
Shadowdale and south of that, the new city of Sudharma. You can also see
a path of iridescent stones trailing off from the stronghold to the east.
Bookshelves line both the northern and southern walls of the room and are
filled with numerous tomes about the law and various other subjects. A
deep-blue colored rug covers part of the marble floor with the Seal of
Justice at its center. You may exit back to the stairwell to the west.

23614.title: A Suspended Walkway
23614.description:
This walkway connects the northern and southern ends of the second
floor of the stronghold. Support beams of painted wood connect reach
across to the base of the domed ceiling and support the walkway. The
walkway itself is made of finely stained and laquered wood. A sturdy
wooden railing keeps you from falling over the edge to the foyer below.
You may walk to the stairwell at the southern end of the walkway or
you may walk northward into the Great Hall.

23615.title: The Great Hall
23615.description:
A great hall sits here. The walls are lined with pictures of past
distinguished members of the Ancient Order of the Justicar. Other relics
of the past are framed along the walls. Small inscriptions describe their
significance. At the eastern end of the hall lies the Council chambers
while the western side of the hall takes you into a place of great power.
You may also exit the hall southward along the suspended walkway.

23616.title: A Wooded Yard
23616.description:
The stronghold opens up in the rear to the wooded area behind. It is so
thick that it is almost impassable and quickly becomes so to the south.
It would be easy for one with knowledge of the woods to hide here. You
may continue through the woods to the east but every other way is
impassable.

23617.title: A Wooded Yard
23617.description:
The stronghold opens up in the rear to the wooded area behind. It is so
thick that it is almost impassable and quickly becomes so to the south.
It would be easy for one with knowledge of the woods to hide here. You
may continue through the woods to the east or west or you may head back
into the stronghold to the north. The way to the south is impassable.

23618.title: A Wooded Yard
23618.description:
The stronghold opens up in the rear to the wooded area behind. It is so
thick that it is almost impassable and quickly becomes so to the south.
It would be easy for one with knowledge of the woods to hide here. You
may continue through the woods to the west but every other way is
impassable.
